title: The William Vale Taps CytexOne to Fully Automate Marquee Smart Hotel
text:
The William Vale Taps CytexOne to Fully Automate Marquee Smart Hotel Boutique hotel selects smart hotel technology expert to deliver smart hotel automation, energy savings and convenience September 16, 2015 11:05 AM   
NEW YORK-  The William Vale , a 21-story luxury hotel development rising in Brooklyn’s affluent Williamsburg neighborhood, today announced it has selected CytexOne , creators of intelligent, connected environments, to provide full-service smart hotel and building automation for its property located at 55 Wythe Avenue in Brooklyn, New York. As part of the agreement, CytexOne Hospitality, a full-service division dedicated to providing integrated platforms and infrastructure to hotels around the world, will deploy a technology automation and energy savings platform that will likely substantially reduce The William Vale’s annual energy costs. 
CytexOne will be planning, designing and deploying a full-scale energy automation system to power the hotel’s control system, which manages and monitors all connected devices in guest rooms and suites, including: Sensors Automated blinds Heating and cooling 
Automation will be triggered by room occupancy and can be remotely monitored and managed by CytexOne’s proprietary cloud-based platform, Atlas. 
“We are competing in a fierce hospitality and commercial real estate market—New York City—and our location attracts a refined and mature audience of guests and locals alike,” said Mordy Steinfeld, Director of Operations with Riverside Developers and The William Vale. “We have a specific goal when it comes to the lifestyle of The William Vale and we know advanced technology and innovation are key components of that. So, we sought out a Smart Hotel partner who could bring us a unified solution that addresses all of our needs - energy efficiency, technology automation, and comfort and convenience for our guests. That’s why we chose CytexOne. We’re confident they will ensure a successful implementation and work alongside our team to meet our objectives. We look forward to the cost benefits of automation but more, the lasting impressions and efficiencies we will deliver to our guests and businesses with our fully-connected Smart Hotel experience.” 
Positioned in one of Brooklyn’s most popular neighborhoods, Williamsburg, The William Vale is one of the most anticipated luxury hotel developments rising to more than 20 stories. From architecture firm, Albo Liberis, the project is expected to set a new architectural and design bar while also bringing 183 rooms to a highly desirable tourist destination. In addition, the project will bring more than 20,000 square-feet of public green space as well as availability for well-aligned branded retailers. The hotel is slated to open in early 2016. 
“The William Vale wanted to fully automate their offices and hotel rooms to create a Smart Hotel environment that instantly reduces energy costs, reduces their carbon footprint and ensures always-on power and technology,” said Dan Levine, CytexOne CEO and co-founder. “They will also offer sleek rooms and suites with personalized touches for guests and sophisticated technology for business customers. We’re excited to help create this Smart Hotel environment, and we will stay on after the installation to help manage and monitor how the property breathes. We can consistently ensure that the property is achieving efficiencies in all areas and that the property remains always-on.” 
Transforming Hospitality for Visitors and Businesses 
CytexOne enables hotels, resorts and other commercial spaces to think and breathe better while keeping guests comfortable and connected. With an ever-growing demand for smarter, connected experiences that retain and increase occupancy, improve energy efficiency, and increase staff productivity, CytexOne helps hotels develop smart technology strategies that engage clientele with connected lighting, surveillance and customized mobile services all at their fingertips through smartphones, tablets and other devices. 
From Riverside Developers, The William Vale will be the latest hotel in Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood when it opens in early 2016 on Wythe Avenue between 12 th and 13 th Streets. Designed by acclaimed architecture firm Albo Liberis, the 21-story hotel is slated to redefine the Brooklyn skyline with its progressive design. With interiors by Munge Leung, the 183-room development will have a forward-looking aesthetic with earth tones and details that pay tribute to Brooklyn. The property will also host a top-tier restaurant and bar, rooftop pool and lounge, 20,000 square feet of retail space and a 20,000 square-foot outdoor public space with unparalleled views of the Manhattan skyline. For more information, visit www.thewilliamvale.com 
About CytexOne 
CytexOne is today’s technology architect for tomorrow’s connected business. With more than 14 years of experience creating automated environments with lighting, security, energy, audio, video, Internet and wireless technologies, CytexOne selects the world’s best-in-breed technologies and integrates and orchestrates devices, systems, software, sensors and services to provide fully managed, self-healing solutions that are remotely monitored 24/7/365 for the health and productivity of any business. By optimizing smart buildings, businesses and homes like no other technology provider can, CytexOne improves the way millions of people experience the world.
